content: First-year, first semester courses for the University of Arizona Software Engineering program include: MATH 122A/B or MATH 125 (Calculus I with Applications, 3 credits), ENGR 102A/B (Introduction to Engineering, 3 credits), ENGL 101, 107, or 109H (First-Year Composition, 3 credits), CHEM 151 or CHEM 161/163 (General Chemistry I, 4 credits), and Introduction to the General Education Experience (1 credit).

First-year, second semester courses include: MATH 129 (Calculus II, 3 credits), SFWE 101 (Introduction to Software Engineering, 3 credits), ENGL 102 or 108 (First-Year Composition, 3 credits), CHEM 152, CHEM 162/164, MSE 110, or MCB 181R/L (General Chemistry II or equivalent, 4 credits), and ECE 101 (Computer Programming I, 4 credits).

Second-year, third semester courses include: ECE 201 (Computer Programming II, 3 credits), PHYS 141 or PHYS 161H (Introductory Mechanics, 4 credits), MATH 243 (Discrete Mathematics in Computer Science, 3 credits), and two General Education Core: Exploring Perspectives courses (3 credits each).

Second-year, fourth semester courses include: SFWE 201 (Sophomore Colloquium, 1 credit), PHYS 241 or PHYS 261H (Introductory Electricity and Magnetism, 4 credits), ECE 274A (Digital Logic, 4 credits), SIE 277 (Object Oriented Modeling and Design, 3 credits), and a Math/Statistics elective selected in consultation with a faculty advisor (3 credits).

Third-year, fifth semester courses include: SFWE 301 (Software Requirements Analysis and Test, 3 credits), SIE 305 (Introduction to Engineering Probability and Statistics, 3 credits), ECE 369A (Computer Organization, or CSC 252 equivalent, 4 credits), and SFWE 303 (Data Persistence, 3 credits).

Third-year, sixth semester courses include: SFWE 302 or SFWE 405 (Software Design Process, 3 credits), SFWE 401 (Software Assurance and Security, 3 credits), one Technical Elective (3 credits), ECE 311 (Engineering Ethics, 1 credit), CSC 355 or CSC 345 (Discrete Structures and Algorithms, 3 credits), and one General Education Core: Building Connections course (3 credits).

Fourth-year, seventh semester courses include: SFWE 403 (Software Project Management, 3 credits), ENGR 498A (Cross-disciplinary Design, Fall only, 3 credits), one Technical Elective (3 credits), one General Education Core: Exploring Perspectives course (3 credits), and one General Education Core: Building Connections course (3 credits).

Fourth-year, eighth semester courses include: SFWE 402 (DevSecOps, 3 credits), ENGR 498B (Cross-disciplinary Design, Spring only, 3 credits), one to three Technical Electives (depending on General Education plan), one General Education Core: Building Connections course (3 credits), and General Education Portfolio (Exit Course, 1 credit).
